subject: Hello , Thank you for your
body:
Hello , Thank you for your email. I know my reply might have come too late. But the situation still remains the same. A day after I sent you this message, we headed out to Mariupol to deliver  humanitarian aid. Unfortunately we were hit by russian artillery and many of our staff lost their lives,  I was badly wounded and I spent 7 months in the ICU.  When I regained consciousness, I couldn't find my phone. I lost everything. But with time I have been able to retrieve and recover my email password. I just logged in now and I saw your message. Thank you for wanting to help. We are still delivering humanitarian aid, the situation has gotten worse than it was when the war started. Ukraine is losing ground due to lack of sufficient ammunition supply from the west. And many people from the west have  moved on from the WAR. But in Ukraine people are dying daily, especially at the frontline villages.
If you still want to help please kindly reach out to me. Nothing is too small at this point. 
Thank you and stay blessed.
Andre

subject: Re:    Hello , Thank you for your
body:
Hello Andre,

I'm so sorry to hear about the difficult circumstances you and your team are facing. It's truly heartbreaking to know that people are suffering daily in Ukraine. I appreciate your courage and dedication in delivering aid despite the dangers.

Could you please share more about how I can help? Are there specific supplies or resources that are most needed at this time? 

Thank you for all that you're doing. Stay safe.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Calvin

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:
Thank you for your reply. In Ukraine everything is needed. To be more
specific, food, clean table water, toiletries, cooking gas, touch lights,
and warm clothes are primarily needed. We have a team that goes to
neighbouring countries to purchase these things and bring them to Ukraine
for deliveries.
Cities like:Avdiivka,Stepove, Severnye,Lastivchyne and Vodyane were
captured by the Russians in the past 3 weeks.Puting pressure on villages
like Berdychi-Semenivka, Orlivka,Tonenka,Pervomaiske Kramatorsk, kupyansk.
These are not the only frontline villages but these are the frontline
villages that Russians are tasked to obliterate next.
The people living in the villages I listed above do not have
electricity and gas. And they are in a dire situation in need of food
supply and water among other things.

Thank you and stay blessed.
Andre

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:
Hello Andre,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's heartbreaking to hear about the situation in Ukraine. I'm curious, how does your team manage to transport these essential items into such dangerous areas? Also, are there any specific types of food or clothing that are more needed than others?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Calvin

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:
Hello Calvin

Thanks for your response. We transport our supplies through the woods, off
roads. It's dangerous but we have no choice, If we stop people will starve
to death.
      There are no specific food items or clothes that are needed, We buy
random food and clothes and distribute them as much as we can.

thank you
Andre

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:

Best wishes,
Calvin

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:
We collaborate with the locals who know their territory well. They took us
through the woods. How do we decide who gets what when distributing the
supplies!. That is a  very good question. What we do most of the time is
that, We pack everything we have on a minibus, when we get to the
communities we ask what they need most and quickly distribute them and
leave.

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:
Hello Calvin Good morning. Like I said before, We collaborate with the
locals who know their terrains well. They took us through the woods. How do
we decide? What we do most  times is that, We pack everything we have on a
minibus, when we get to the communities we ask what they need most and
quickly distribute them and leave.
Mr Calvin we are running out of supplies, If you can contribute anything
let me know. People are in dire need of whatever supply they can survive
with. A monetary  support will be most appreciated. Our staff will be going
to the neighbouring country for a new supply with the little fund we have.
Kindly let me know how you would like to support. Together we will win.
Glory to Ukraine, Glory to Europe.

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:

I'm curious, how do you usually handle the logistics of getting supplies to these remote areas? And what kind of items are most in demand?

As for contributing, I'd love to help out in any way I can. However, could you please provide more details on how the process works? How does one go about making a contribution?

Best wishes,
Calvin

subject: Re: Hello , Thank you for your
body:
The purpose of the account is to receive international monetary donations.
We use the money received in this account, to buy the food and supplies
needed by Ukrainian refugees.
